newsitem.title: USA: Buckle April same store sales up 10.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Buckle April same store sales up 10.2 pct.

text.p: Buckle Inc said Thursday its same-store sales for the four-week period ended May 3, 1997 rose 10.2 percent over the comparable period a year ago.
Total sales increased 20.7 percent to $14.1 million from $11.7 million in the corresponding four-week period of fiscal 1996.

Net sales year-to-date, for the thirteen weeks ended May 3, 1997, increased 21.1 percent to $48.3 million from $39.9 million for the corresponding thirteen weeks in the prior year. Comparable store sales year-to-date were up 10.8 percent from the previous year.

Buckle also said its store in Grand Forks, N.D. was closed for 16 days during this four-week period due to flooding within the city. Although the store has currently been given permission to open again, it will be operating on a reduced schedule, the retailer said in a statement.
Buckle operates 186 retail stores in 23 states, up from 171 stores in 22 states at this same time a year ago.
